Posts.Content: May 3, 2011 02:21AM Lillian wrote: I was always scared that messing with cancer (like doing a biopsy) would spread it.  I wanted to wait and watch.  I said I'd heard of that, why couldn't we do that?  He said if it's something they can feel, they always do biopsy no matter what.  That's the way my doctor did it anyway.  I decided I was okay with that because if it wasn't cancer, what harm would it have been?  And if it was cancer, I would want it out immediately.  It's just me and my experiece, but I don't see any reason not to have a biopsy.  At the same time, if it is cancer, it didn't get there overnight.  A week or two more shouldn't make a difference.
Posts.Title: Need Help fiaa Lillian
